body_html:
sparse::SpareTensor represents a sparse value, not a symbolic input to an op. Note that SparseTensor is used in op kernels, but not in the C++ graph-building API.

I agree though that it would be useful to have a symbolic SparseTensor concept in the C++ API, similar to in the Python API. I'll mark this as a feature request.
body_text:
sparse::SpareTensor represents a sparse value, not a symbolic input to an op. Note that SparseTensor is used in op kernels, but not in the C++ graph-building API.
I agree though that it would be useful to have a symbolic SparseTensor concept in the C++ API, similar to in the Python API. I'll mark this as a feature request.
body:
`sparse::SpareTensor` represents a sparse value, not a symbolic input to an op. Note that SparseTensor is used in op kernels, but not in the C++ graph-building API.

I agree though that it would be useful to have a symbolic SparseTensor concept in the C++ API, similar to in the Python API. I'll mark this as a feature request.
